intro: Torenia siamensis, commonly known as the Siam torenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are known for their tubular shape and vibrant color. Torenia siamensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
